attributes.action: Bring in a recognised standard of safety for installation of blinds.
attributes.background: For years the blind industry has the good and the bad installers, which is the same in a lot of industries but this can be the case of life or death when cords are involved.
attributes.additional_details: There are many cases of children losing their lives to poorly installed blinds due to the cording.

attributes.action: Abortion time to be lowered from 24 to 16 weeks.
attributes.background: Survival rates of premature babies have improved since 1990, when the law was last changed. Medical science and tech have made it easier for premature babies to survive at earlier dates. It's inhumane that this law hasn't been revised in nearly 20 years.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/uknews/1976846/Why-this-abortion-doctor-wants-to-see-time-limits-reduced-to-16-weeks.html

attributes.action: Introduce official national ID cards or make PASS cards part of the law
attributes.background: Many people lose their IDs such as driving license which is difficult and costly to replace.PASS hologram cards supposedly should fix this problem but until this day not every place recognises this type of identification.We need the government to introduce something that would be recognisable fully
attributes.additional_details: PASS hologram cards don’t work everywhere from my experience as many places like nightclubs are not even aware of them and usually they reject people that have them. What is the point for the government to support a scheme that is not effective. We need a government issued national ID or make PASS hologram cards part of official identification here in England in order to solve this problem as carrying driving licences or passports is a big risk to take and a long process to replace

attributes.action: More effort to increase the peace process between Israel and Palestine
attributes.background: The UK Government should carry out a detailed review of all its efforts towards facilitating the peace process between Israel and Palestine. This review should identify what hasn’t been done and recommend new action that the Government could take.
attributes.additional_details: For so long people have seen these two states as enemies and for too long innocent people have been brought into a conflict which deeply effects the progression of life in this area of the world. It is time for this to stop.

attributes.action: For victims of crime to have rights to appeal a not guilty verdict.
attributes.background: After taking my abusers to court, they were found not guilty. We should have rights like the person found guilty has fair justice. If the person's found guilty they can appeal against the sentence or case. Victims should have a proper right to appeal.
attributes.additional_details: And when the CPS and police mess your case up, like mine, there should be the right for victims to appeal. There is not enough space to put everything on. But I reach out to other victims and people in England to, get a fair justice system for now and in the future. With rights other victims may come forward.

attributes.action: Protection for WW2 RN wrecks that are being blown up & the sailors desecrated
attributes.background:
Royal navy wrecks from ww2 are at risk of being blown up for scrap metal in south East Asia.
Dutch wrecks have simply disappeared.
Our dead saliors have a claim on us to protect them in death as they protected us in life.

No WW2 Royal Navy battleships are preserved. We risk losing them forever
attributes.additional_details:
Everything I have said in the background information is able to be checked in Google and I have come across information in the media, see link below
https://www.theguardian.com/world/ng-interactive/2017/nov/03/worlds-biggest-grave-robbery-asias-disappearing-ww2-shipwrecks

attributes.action: Make repeat offenders pay a percentage for emergency service costs
attributes.background:
Persons who are being repeatdly arrested for offending for: affray, public disturbance, ABH or GBH should pay a percentage of the emergency service costs which attended the scene.
Court costs recover some expenses but not all. A levy should be applied in these cases.
attributes.additional_details:
This method would help as a deterrent to knife attacks/gang crime, and it would also make it fair for persons who do not cause undue expenses from the emergency services.
Crime is on the rise and there are more gangs than ever.
This levy could also be expanded to moped theft gangs for the expense of a vehicle/foot pursuit.
Some persons cannot afford fines, but in that case then this would also help a legal case to get the dangerous repeat offenders locked up.

attributes.action: Stop the 3.2% increase on rail fares set for 2019 after a disastrous 2018
attributes.background: The UK has some of the most expensive rail ticket prices in Europe. The catastrophic implementation of the 2020 plan show all train companies don't have a customer-centric approach and neglect users. Before raising prices, the government should put in place effective quality control system.

attributes.action: Funding home visits in times of crisis by trained mental health professionals
attributes.background: After a local woman tried to take her life, the community were left horrified in discovering proper professional help was not available to her, and she was left for hours before receiving the help she needed.
attributes.additional_details:
We are calling for more funding and correct training for these circumstances so that no one needing help in times of crisis are left without it. This woman was fortunate to have a strong community of neighbours who were able to help her.

It's easy to point the finger and say people in need should seek help, but what happens when the help just isn't there?

attributes.action: Make teaching sexual abuse/assualt in more detail part of the curriculum
attributes.background: Many people (adults and children alike) who have been abused often say that they didn't realise what was happening was actually abuse for a very long time.  By educating children about what is abuse will empower them to protect themselves.  Abusers rely ignorance and secrecy.
attributes.additional_details: By talking about abuse of any kind openly and freely we take away the secrecy and make it less of a taboo subject and people may, hopefully, 1. be more aware of how to protect themselves, 2. feel more able to speak up if something does happen to them, 3. make abusers more wary of abusing.

attributes.action: Require ride-sharing services to give drivers equity to operate in the UK
attributes.background: To get a license to operate in the UK, all "gig economy" types of companies such as Uber, Gett, Deliveroo, etc. would be required to designate a pool of equity (or cash from its sale) to its workers. This would be distributed on a negotiated per mile/hour basis + a 'time on network' + rating policy.
attributes.additional_details:
Protect Intelligent Systems Workers

Any worker who contributes to an intelligent network, AI or algorithm that will put their long-term work at risk should participate in the long-term equity success of that network or system because they are helping to build it.

The government should make this equity grant a requirement of entry into any city or town and should hold in escrow either equity, funds or both to protect the longterm future of these intelligent systems workers. 

www.found.ee/taxi

attributes.action: Install a fence or screen in the middle of motorways to prevent rubber necking
attributes.background: Rubber necking creates massive amounts of traffic even on a road that is totally unaffected. For example, an accident on the opposite carriage can cause a queue or a crash due to people looking across the road instead of where they're going. We need to install screens or barriers to prevent this!

attributes.action: Horn honking/sexual slurs shouted out of car windows to women to be an offence.
attributes.background: The majority of women while in public have to endure multiple forms of harassment, from horn honking to misogynistic sexual slurs shouted out of vehicle windows, whether travelling to work or visiting local shops women endure constant verbal harassment. All women should feel safe on our streets.
attributes.additional_details: My personal experience has a 20 year old women living on a main road traveling the 30 minute journey to work I receive upwards of 3 vocal forms of sexual harassment I am made to feel like a piece of meat. Why should this injustice which has occurred for generations in our society be accepted. An online form where victims of this behaviour can report offending vehicle registration numbers to the local authority and a sanction procedure should be in place to prevent these acts being committed.

attributes.action: Scrap the MOT test.
attributes.background: The MOT test is outdated and does not save lives but only costs motorists money.

attributes.action: Equal rights for boys up to their 18th birthday to receive the HPV vaccine.
attributes.background: Today 24/7/18, the government announced that boys aged 12-13 will receive the HPV vaccine from 2019. While this is great news,   I would like to petition the government to increase the age limit to the same that is offered to girls, up to their 18th birthday.
attributes.additional_details:
A jab that protects against a virus that causes cervical cancer will be given to boys aged 12 to 13 in England. 
The policy decision brings England into line with Scotland and Wales. 
HPV vaccine is already routinely offered to girls of the same age at secondary school and is free up until they turn 18.
Experts and campaigners have been calling for equal access to the jab, which can also guard against oral, throat and anal cancers.

attributes.action: Make it legal in England to marry in a forest as it legal in Scotland
attributes.background: My son and his fiancee would like as would possibly many others to marry in a forest. Please help to try and make this happen

attributes.action: Provide option to pay an extra 10 to 20% Council Tax & choose where it's spent.
attributes.background:
With all the cuts to services I suggest people are given the OPTION to pay an extra 10, 15 or 20% on their Council Tax via a tick box AND be able to choose where the money is allocated via a few more tick boxes i.e.
- Policing
- NHS
- Schools
- Local Town Council
- Social Services
attributes.additional_details:
Many of us are unhappy & frustrated with the spending cuts that have impacted so many services. There is too much emphasis on keeping Council Tax down without giving people the OPTION to pay more if they want to and have a say in where it is spent. 

I would be happy to pay an extra 10% provided it went on local policing and I am sure many people who could afford it would feel the same, albeit with differing priorities.

attributes.action: Increase government funding for assisted living facilities in care homes.
attributes.background: How much do you think care homes cost per week? You'd be surprised to find out the national average is £600, excluding nursing. This high price tag does not match the quality of the services provided. Help us to change this, as well as your possible future.
attributes.additional_details: We are Team Ward from Preston NCS - Wave 4. NCS, which stands for National Citizen Service, is a programme which encourages young people to engage in social action and make a difference in society. Recently, we visited a local care home. We were shocked at the visible lack of staff to help support the service users when we arrived. After this experience, we decided we were going to try and make a difference by starting this petition.

attributes.action: Ban fake numbers being used for sales, marketing, PPI and personal injury calls.
attributes.background:
We frequently receive calls about that 'accident' we've had or about that PPI claim we could make.

Companies use a fake number, so that you have no way of tracing where the call from and so they are unaccountable.  

I propose that UK phone networks apply technology to block such calls.

attributes.action: Ban smoking within 6 meters from public entrances; exempting pubs and clubs.
attributes.background: As an extension to the Health Act of 2006, extending the ban around public entrances further benefits non-smokers, while not providing additional hardships on smokers.  This benefits ground level offices mostly as smokers usually do so just outside, causing smoke to drift into nearby windows.
attributes.additional_details: In the strictest sense, no law regarding entrance proximity contravenes the Health Act as these environments are no longer smoke free.  While one cannot control wind direction and the like, distance away from these entrances would normally include distance from windows, as well as provide a better environment for visitors.  This ensures the well being and comfort of non-smokers indoors remains intact, and only requires smokers to travel a few additional steps.

attributes.action: Prevent those in Public Service from withholding data
attributes.background: Data laws are being used to cover up & block complaints. Organisations and public bodies should have to prove in court that a request is vexatious before they can refuse to give information. The ICO should be given the funds and powers to fully investigate non-compliance with the law.
attributes.additional_details: Those who don't fully comply with a request in 1 calendar month must be fined. The impact on those who suffer failure, abuse and hostility is worse if they can't access all their records to pursue a complaint. It affects the most vulnerable, those on low incomes who may not be able to access public services e.g. housing, disabled facilities, innocent children forced out of school, school bullying covered up that may lead to children self-harming or children/individuals targeted by authorities.

attributes.action: Have a Nicola Sturgeon statue in Westminster
attributes.background: I would like a Nicola Sturgeon statue built in the House of Commons.

attributes.action: Make Football compulsory for all schools across the UK (Public and State)
attributes.background: Football is the biggest sport in the world with over 1/3rd of England watching the World Cup games that England were involved in. Some children do not get the chance to play football and excel at the sport, public and state schools.
attributes.additional_details: Every pupil deserves the chance to be involved in a team sport, where it is not physical like rugby, which some students do not want to partake in due to fear of injury.

attributes.action: I believe that it should be mandatory for ALL lunch breaks to be paid.
attributes.background: As of right now, when working on the minimum wage, the employee will lose either £36.90 or £39.15 each week, depending on age group. This is roughly £147.60 or £156.60 lost each month. In my opinion, this is outrageous; ultimately feeling like being punished for needing to eat and rest.

attributes.action: Increase funding for local councils to tackle homelessness.
attributes.background: Poverty in general is a prevalent issue in the UK; homelessness rates have been significantly increasing; why is the government's form of action evidently not working, if there is any?

attributes.action: Public transport(bus) to have cabin filters to protect passengers and drivers
attributes.background: high pollution is danger for all of us, the cabin filter will protect and save lives
attributes.additional_details: it was a few documentary on tv shown that danger (heavy) car emission are cumulated in public transport like tram and buses. The ventilate is not an option, a proper pollen filter will make a different and it will save some lives, and help

attributes.action: Include awareness of emotional and physical abuse to the national curriculum
attributes.background: We're at a time in our lives and our society where abuse, emotional or physical, is being seen as normal. Children as young as even 10 or some younger are not able to recognise normal behaviour anymore and see abuse of any kind as normal. This needs to stop now, any age it's not acceptable.

attributes.action: Replace the financial ombudsman service with a publicly funded organisation
attributes.background: I believe that the ombudsman service just has not got the ability to handle complaints about financial services. There is evidence in the media and on online review services like trustpilot.
attributes.additional_details: I would like the government to consider replacing the financial ombudsman service with a publicly funded organisation that is not funded by, or affiliated with, the banks and other financial services.

attributes.action: To implement a notice period before stopping disability benefits after reviewing
attributes.background: At present many genuine disability claimants are losing benefits without any prior warning after going through a biased assessment process. Thus placing them instantly into financial difficulties and a world of uncertainty & worry even rendering many unable to actually pay the bills etc.
attributes.additional_details: Being thrust into a world of woe. Going through the stresses of being suddenly financially restricted then chasing the gov for reconsideration and then forcing an appeal process which many win this process surely costs the gov even more going through the whole tribunal process takes months to  year. Yes the money gets backdated. But all that addition stress and worry is totally Unnecessary. In human rights terms it's totally disgusting that our DWP treats the disabled this way.

attributes.action: Make Government Funds Available for Victims & Families of Terrorist Attacks
attributes.background:
I was shocked to recently learn that there is ‘No’ financial funding help for victims or their families of terrorist attacks in the U.K. 
In light of the Manchester Arena bombing, and the 22 victims, London Bridge Attack, Westminster Attack, Finsbury Park Attack in 2017 we should be helping.
attributes.additional_details:
Financial Funds need to be made available for victims and their families , and those who have been affected by incidents of terrorism in the United Kingdom. There needs to be a special fund set up to help these people, and their families who need to take time off work, to look after family members, general living expenses, and specialist care.
This is the least we can do as a nation, to help people who need it the most. After experiencing such life affecting atrocities!

attributes.action: Make a legal requirement to have a valid horse owners certificate to own a horse
attributes.background: Currently any individual can own a horse or pony regardless of their knowledge of basic horse care. This has led to a rise in equine welfare cases, with many horses/ponies being neglected, abused and killed due to the owners lack of fundamental equine care knowledge.
attributes.additional_details: The horse owners certificate is already an optional qualification provided by the British horse society. It teaches a person essential knowledge on equine maintenance, nutrition, care and first aid. Making this qualification a legal requirement for all horse owners will have a dramatic positive effect in the equestrian community and will aim to massively reduce the number of welfare cases involving horses inappropriately cared for.

attributes.action: Using a mobile phone whilst driving change to a 6 month ban and £1500 fine
attributes.background:
The current law of a few points and a small fine is no real deterrent 
On a daily basis I see people in traffic queues on phones 
It should apply too whenever the engine is running (sat in traffic )
Bluetooth systems are very cheap so no excuse to text or call with your hands off the wheel

attributes.action: Urge the Commonwealth to suspend Pakistan’s membership.
attributes.background: The former Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif, has not been given a fair trial by the Supreme Court of Pakistan. His life and political career may be in danger.
attributes.additional_details:
The Supreme Court of Pakistan has taken away the right from Nawaz Sharif to contest the next general elections in Pakistan. He has also been disqualified from Prime Ministership. Nawaz Sharif is a target of the Pakistan Army and Supreme Court of Pakistan. 
 
The UK Government should urge the Commonwealth Ministerial Action Group to suspend Pakistan’s Commonwealth membership, until they give fair trial and right to contest election to Nawaz Sharif.

attributes.action: Provide mental health training to all teachers
attributes.background: Specialised mental health training for teachers will help them to identify children with mental health issues and get them the help they need. I want an end to the stigma.

attributes.action: Stop stretched NHS staff being criminalised and struck off for honest mistakes.
attributes.background: We ask government to adopt a ‘just’ approach in healthcare investigation to ensure staff aren’t scapegoated for systemic errors. 1) Change the Law so staff errors are only prosecuted if intentional or grossly careless 2) Change the Medical Act so regulators are limited to retraining, not punishment.
attributes.additional_details:
NHS working conditions are incredibly stretched. Despite understaffing and underfunding, staff face criminal charges and losing their licence to work forever if they make an honest mistake. This is unfair, unconstructive and worsens patient safety. 

We ask government to adopt a ‘just’/‘no blame’ approach to healthcare investigation (like the aviation industry) to save taxpayers money, improve NHS working conditions and staff retainment, and streamline error investigation to make patients safer.

This petition has been co-authored by Dr Hugo Farne and Dr Jenny Vaughan

attributes.action: Make it illegal for freeholders to receive insurance commission over 10%
attributes.background: Landlords and/or their associates receive hidden commission on buildings insurance at the expense of leasehold owners, and this is often grossly excessive.
attributes.additional_details: There are numerous Lands Tribunal cases correcting this but this would not be necessary if it was made law.

attributes.action: To have a second referendum on Britain leaving the EU
attributes.background:
It's no secret that a vast amount of people who voted to leave the EU didn't realise what they were voting for. 

The Leave campaign said that leaving would create new trade deals, strengthen the economy and public services and reduce the number of incoming immigrants. But this is not happening.
attributes.additional_details:
Theresa May has really struggled so far in Brexit negotiations and time is running out. She's failing to secure trade deals and my personal biggest fear is the Irish Border, this could lead to a United Ireland.

May has lost support not only from the Cabinet but the whole nation. I'm calling for a second referendum, because if you voted to remain or to leave we need a final say. The Brexit decision was so tight and I just think that it help everyone if there was a second vote. Sign if you agree.

attributes.action: universal credit to pay rent cost during the 4week period before first payment
attributes.background: Universal credit is causing a big problem for people falling into rent arrears at the beginning the claim by making the claimant have to wait an initial period of 4-5 weeks before issuing the first Payment in which rent arrears are building up and already people are at risk of Losing their homes.
attributes.additional_details: There used to be help for when people returned to work by giving a grace period of 1 months extra housing benefit to help with the transition from jobseekers allowance to work before the housing benefit was cancelled. Could something like this be actioned?  especially when you are moving people from an old existing benefit into the new umbrella of universal credit and rent arrears will have started accumulating. Was this 4-5wk period never thought about?! and the awful knock on effect to follow?

attributes.action: Lower the tax for fuel so it’s more affordable
attributes.background: The fuel prices in the uk are reaching an all time high, other country’s pay way less on fuel! This needs to be actioned now !

attributes.action: Reform use of non-disclosure agreements (NDAs) in employment
attributes.background: Settlements that include NDAs remain secret. This can perpetuate a culture of bullying and victimisation and allow abuse to remain unchallenged. All NDAs should explicitly say that employees or ex-employees are allowed to talk about any bullying and harassment they might have seen or experienced.
attributes.additional_details: The opposite view, that payments routinely reward false allegations, also leads to the same conclusion. These NDAs are inappropriate.

attributes.action: Introduce conjugal visits in the United Kingdom
attributes.background: In many other countries conjugal visits are permitted. However, in the U.K. it is not permitted. the biggest advantages of allowing conjugal visits is prisoners tend to follow the rules for fear of losing their right to have a visit. Moreover, the biggest advantage is families no longer suffer.
attributes.additional_details: Conjugal visits are allowed in Australia, Brazil, Canada, Denmark, Germany, india, Israel, Mexico, Russia, Saudi Arabia, and Spain. In the US, conjugal visits are not allowed in Federal prisons, but California, New York, Mississippi, Washington, and Connecticut permit them.

attributes.action: Introduce hypothecated tax to support NHS by regulated distribution of cannabis.
attributes.background:
The NHS needs far more money funded from central government in order to continue to provide for everyone's physical and mental health needs in the U.K.
Evidence from some states in the US including Colorado demonstrate that legislative amendments regarding cannabis have produce substantial revenue.
attributes.additional_details:
Colorado has an geographical area similar to the United Kingdom with a population of 5 million, similar in size to Scotland. The Colorado Department of Revenue began collecting data in February 2014. In 2017 over $247 Million was raised. The total economic impact has been calculated at over $1.5 Billion.
Please refer to website link:
www.colorado.gov/pacific/revenue/colorado-marijuana-tax-data

attributes.action: Ask the government to increase funding for osteoporosis
attributes.background:
The information that is out there is vague nothing definitive also testing not done until too late in most cases 
Like lots of diseases early diagnosis is the way forward

attributes.action: Stop the bedroom tax and stop homelessness increasing.
attributes.background:
The government should stop the bedroom tax and help the vulnerable on
limited budgets. Homelessness is on the increase and this tax is helping
towards those figures due to people not been able to pay for the rent shortfall out of their limited benefits.
attributes.additional_details: With the universal credits system taking 6 weeks before getting paid, the bedroom tax is another expense that people are struggling with and making people homeless.

attributes.action: Make all new school buses zero-emission vehicles from 2020.
attributes.background: Over a million children in the UK use school transport provided by transit buses, contracted coaches, minibuses and taxis each day. We’re asking the government to ensure the vehicles carrying our children to school don’t add to the already harmful levels of air pollution.
attributes.additional_details:
Air quality in the UK has been described as a public health emergency contributing to 40,000 premature deaths per year and it's small children who are affected the most. Electric school bus motors
produce zero emissions. This means cleaner, healthier air while
kids wait to board the bus & inside the cabin.

attributes.action: Remove the verbal option from Food Information Regulations on Allergens.
attributes.background:
With so many people now suffering food allergies and other food related conditions, it is not acceptable for anyone to rely on word of mouth about the ingredients used.
It is not possible for staff to remember every ingredient in a dish, and there needs to be documentation to prove due diligence.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, it is considered acceptable for food businesses to provide allergen information verbally, however, with the high staff turnover for which the hospitality industry is renowned, this is not adequate, safe, reliable, or practical. 
It is much more practical to provide written documents with full ingredients lists, to use standardised recipes, and have staff trained on accredited courses. In a court of law, a business must 'prove due diligence', this, surely, cannot be achieved verbally.

attributes.action: Make the NHS exempt from paying business rates.
attributes.background: NHS Hospitals are facing rising business rates whilst private hospitals are able to register as a charity saving them around 80% on their business rates.

attributes.action: Make CCTV mandatory on streets where crime doubles in 6 months.
attributes.background: Hotspots of escalating crime figures are indications of organised crime where false reporting and framing of individuals for crimes they didnt commit can become more likely. CCTV is advisable on streets where crime figures double in 6 months
attributes.additional_details: Sign the petition and change the law so CCTV stops gangs lying to the police

attributes.action: Make Humanist weddings legally recognised in England and Wales
attributes.background: Humanist weddings have been legal in Scotland for over a decade, but in England and Wales they are not legally recognised. Couples wanting to have a Humanist ceremony have to pay to be legally married by a registrar separately to their Humanist ceremony, increasing costs and practicality issues.
attributes.additional_details:
https://humanism.org.uk/ceremonies/non-religious-weddings/faqs/

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/sep/17/humanist-weddings-scotland-england-wales

https://humanism.org.uk/2018/05/24/parliamentarians-call-for-legal-humanist-marriages-in-england-and-wales/

attributes.action: Ask the Indian government to take action against the persecution of Christians
attributes.background: India is an ally of the UK and also the world's largest democracy. The UK should ask the Indian government to allow more religious freedom and take action against the rising persecution of Christians at the hands of Hindu radical groups.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/world/2008/oct/19/orissa-violence-india-christianity-hinduism 

https://www.opendoorsusa.org/christian-persecution/world-watch-list/india/

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Religious_violence_in_Odisha 

https://www.christiantoday.com/article/hindu-extremists-threaten-to-kill-christians-in-india-if-they-utter-the-name-of-christ/63567.htm 

http://www.foxnews.com/world/2016/03/14/christian-persecution-by-hindus-rises-in-india-say-humanitarian-groups.html
